intro: Hieracium eriophyllum var. pleiophyllum, commonly known as the many-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with erect, hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, producing yellow flowers that attract pollinators. This variant is distinguished by its abundance of small, clustered flowers, giving it a dense, fluffy appearance.
